resources.string: Shuruat is an app designed to help the nearly 500 million+ rural women and 20 million small and unorganized businesses across the country get access to financial assistance through NBFCs, providing financial literacy especially in the areas of starting small businesses, retail investing. The app also comes with the added features of helping users navigate and create awareness about government schemes and policies. This app has been created and is being managed by IgniteIndia led by two teenagers- Vivaan Garg and Avaya Aggarwal
\“Unleashing the vast human capital of India by providing financial assistance, literacy and access to government schemes to rural women and small businesses\”
Briefly explain why you require financial assistance
\“Economic growth without the growth of the poorest of the poor isn’t not growth at all \” - Amartya Sen
Maharaja Agrasen Institute of Technology PSP Area, Plot No. 1, Sector-22, Rohini, Delhi-110086 INDIA.

At Shuruat, our mission is to empower financially challenged students by providing them with the necessary tools, resources, and support to overcome financial barriers and pursue their educational dreams. We are dedicated to streamlining the process of connecting students to financial assistance, creating a comprehensive database that enables organizations and institutions to enhance access to education. Through collaboration and advocacy, we aim to create a more equitable educational landscape where every student has the opportunity to thrive. Our mission is to be a catalyst for change, breaking down barriers and transforming lives through the power of education.

Our vision is to democratize access to finance and financial literacy across India. The female labor force participation rate for India is less than 25% for the year 2023. One of our core beliefs is that India will only transition from a developing to a developed economy by achieving total and complete gender equity; therefore this app has a special emphasis on increasing access to finance for rural women and making them self-reliant by fostering entrepreneurship
